[[Gibson Les Paul]]
Gibson Les Paul Special
Fender Telecaster |website = }} '''Jason White''' (born November 11, 1973 in [[Little Rock, Arkansas]]) is an American guitarist who has played in various [[punk rock]] bands. He is most notable for being the long-time touring lead guitarist for [[Green Day]] and guitarist for Californian punk quartet [[Pinhead Gunpowder]]. Jason White has been a touring member of Green Day since 1999 when they recorded ''[[Warning (Green Day album)|Warning]]''. He is co-founder of [[Billie Joe Armstrong]]'s record label [[Adeline Records]].{{cite web|url=http://www.greendayauthority.com/TheBand/jwprofile.php|title=GDA - Jason White Profile|publisher=The Green Day Authority|accessdate=25 September 2010}} == Biography == === Early musical acts: 1992-1999 === In summer 1992, White filled in guitar duties at the last minute for Bay Area punk band [[Monsula]], who were performing at Little Rock, AR club Vino's. After the performance, Jason toured as guitarist for the band and eventually relocated to the Bay Area after the breakup of Chino Horde in summer 1993. As a friend of punk rock trio [[Green Day]], he appeared in the "[[When I Come Around]]" video, where he is seen making out with a girl (his real-life girlfriend at the time). In 1994, White joined punk quartet [[Pinhead Gunpowder]] after the departure of singer/guitarist [[Mike Kirsch]] (with whom White had played the previous year in Sixteen Bullets). White joined [[The Big Cats]] in 1996, after the temporary departure of bassist Josh Bentley, and took over guitar duties in 2000 after the death of guitarist Shannon Yarbrough. The group is a side project of many musicians, playing live very rarely. Their newest record, ''On Tomorrow'', was released in 2007. When Green Day/Pinhead Gunpowder frontman [[Billie Joe Armstrong]] started [[Adeline Records]] in 1997, Jason helped him run it. He re-appeared with Armstrong for two Green Day shows in 1999, both of which raised money for the [[Bridge School Benefit]]. After making ''[[Warning (Green Day album)|Warning]],'' Green Day asked him to assist them on their tour as a second guitarist. === The Influents and The Network: 2000-2003 === Because of Pinhead Gunpowder's infamy for sporadic get-togethers, White and Gunpowder bassist [[Bill Schneider (musician)|Bill Schneider]] began looking to form another band that would be a group the two could focus on. After recruiting Schneider's brother Greg Schneider to join and finally convincing Willie Samuels to play drums, [[The Influents]] were formed. White and Greg would become the focus of the band, splitting songwriting duties, as well as singing time. Bill Schneider left the band on good terms after group's first album ''[[Check Please]]'' to focus on his drum shop and was soon replaced by Johnnie Wentz. The new line-up soon recorded a follow up, ''[[Some of the Young]]'', and went on tour. Due to personal and creative differences, as well as White's growing dedication to Green Day, The Influents dissolved in 2003. {{citation needed|date=November 2010}} In 2003, allegedly under the name Balducci, White joined the members of Green Day for their side-project [[The Network]]. The band has released one album so far, called ''[[Money Money 2020]]''. === American Idiot: 2004-2005 === With the release of ''[[American Idiot (album)|American Idiot]]'', White was required again to play with the band during the supporting tour of the album. In February 2005, Jason got married.[http://www.greendayauthority.com/TheBand/jwprofile.php GDA | Jason White Profile] That year, he played with Green Day in their video, "[[Wake Me Up When September Ends]]" – the first time that any musician outside the trio appeared as a performer in a Green Day video. He also appears along the band in their 2005 live CD/DVD ''[[Bullet in a Bible]]''. === Covers and Habitat for Humanity: 2006-2007 === In 2006, Jason recorded a cover of [[The Replacements (band)|The Replacements]] "Torture" for the Replacements Cover compilation, "[[We'll Inherit the Earth: A Tribute to The Replacements|We'll Inherit the Earth]]". Hes also featured in the May 2007 release, ''Towncraft'',{{cite web|url=http://www.towncraftmovie.com|title=Towncraft the Movie|accessdate=24 September 2010}} a documentary covering twenty years of the punk music scene in Little Rock, AR, White's home. That same year, White played with Green Day in the video for the cover of "[[Working Class Hero]]." In April 2007, White and his wife joined Armstrong and his family in their Spring Break working with [[Habitat For Humanity]] and writing a diary for GreenDay.net. === Foxboro Hot Tubs and 21st Century Breakdown: 2008-present day === In 2008, White joined Green Day's side project [[Foxboro Hot Tubs]] as lead guitarist along with Kevin Preston of [[Prima Donna (American band)|Prima Donna]] on rhythm guitar.{{cite web|url=http://www.punknews.org/article/28471|title=Green Day confirm that they are Foxboro Hot Tubs. Everyone act surprised|date=April 10, 2008|publisher=Punknews.org|accessdate=21 September 2010}} In 2009, he toured with Green Day in support for their latest record, ''[[21st Century Breakdown]]''. White made his fourth appearance on a Green Day video for "[[21 Guns (song)|21 Guns]]" and his fifth in "[[Last of the American Girls]]"; prior to this, and not including his live appearances on "[[Jesus of Suburbia]]" and "[[East Jesus Nowhere]]", he had appeared in three Green Day videos: "[[When I Come Around]]", "[[Wake Me Up When September Ends]]" and "[[Working Class Hero#Notable covers|Working Class Hero]]". On July 13, 2010, Max Recordings released White's debut 45 single - "[[Hungover (Jason White song)|Hungover]]" b/w "I'm A Mess".{{cite web|url=http://www.arktimes.com/RockCandy/archives/2010/07/09/max-releasing-jason-white-7|title=Max releasing Jason White 7|last=Tarpley|first=John|date=July 9, 2010|publisher=Arkansas times|accessdate=16 July 2010}} He appeared once again as Green Day's sideman for their 2011 live album [[Awesome As Fuck]]. == Personal life == {{Expand section|date=July 2010}} === Tattoo === Jason has a tattoo of a small flower on his right hand, about level with his wrist and got the tattoo after marrying his current wife Janna (formerly Rollins). == Associated acts == *Numbskulz (guitar, 1988) *Step By Step (vocals, 1989â1990) *[[Chino Horde]] (bass, 1990â1993) *Fishwagon (guitar/vocals, 1991) *[[Monsula]] (guitar, 1992â1993) *Pretty (bass, 1993) *Sixteen Bullets (bass, 1994) *[[Pinhead Gunpowder]] (guitar/vocals, 1995âpresent) *The Big Cats (bass/vocals, 1996â2000; guitar/vocals, 2000âpresent) *[[Green Day]] (tour lead guitar/vocals, 1998âpresent) *[[The Influents]] (guitar/vocals, 1999â2003) *The Kicks (guitar, 2000â2004) *[[The Network]] (credited as Balducci, guitar, 2003âpresent) *[[Foxboro Hot Tubs]] (guitar, 2007âpresent) == Equipment == '''Guitars''' *[[Gibson Les Paul]] 1958 plain top reissue *Gibson Les Paul 1957 gold top reissue *Gibson Les Paul 1959 Special *Gibson SG *[[Gibson ES-335]] dot reissue (which features a fishman powerbridge for acoustic sound) '''Amplification''' *Marshall Plexi amplifier heads (modded with Dookie Mod and SE Lead mod - Modded by Martin Golub) and two Marshall 4x12" cabinets *Custom Audio Electronics CAE 3+ Tube Preamp '''Effects''' *Xotic RC Booster *Line6 Echo Pro rack delay *Line6 DL4 Delay Modeller == References == == External links == *{{IMDb name|2083443|Jason White}} *[http://www.maxrecordings.com/#/jason-white/4542115402 Profile] on [[Max Recordings]] {{Green Day}} {{Persondata | NAME = White, Jason | ALTERNATIVE NAMES = | SHORT DESCRIPTION = | DATE OF BIRTH = November 11, 1973 | PLACE OF BIRTH = | DATE OF DEATH = | PLACE OF DEATH = }} {{DEFAULTSORT:White, Jason}} [[Category:1973 births]] [[Category:Living people]] [[Category:American punk rock guitarists]] [[Category:American punk rock musicians]] [[Category:Lead guitarists]] [[Category:Green Day members]] [[Category:Musicians from Arkansas]] [[Category:People from Little Rock, Arkansas]] [[cs:Jason White]] [[de:Jason White (Musiker)]] [[es:Jason White]] [[fr:Jason White (musicien)]] [[it:Jason White (musicista)]] [[hu:Jason White]] [[ja:ã¸ã§ã¤ã½ã³ã»ãã¯ã¤ã]] [[no:Jason White]] [[pl:Jason White]] [[pt:Jason White]] [[ru:Ð£Ð°Ð¹Ñ, ÐÐ¶ÐµÐ¹ÑÐ¾Ð½]] [[simple:Jason White (musician)]] [[fi:Jason White]] [[sv:Jason White]] [[tr:Jason White]]
